latestVersion.confidentialityDeclaration: All files for this project/study, except for the Project Description, need to be directly downloaded from SSD's Farm Household Survey Database's online link: http://ricestat.irri.org/fhsd/
latestVersion.termsOfAccess:
Project files like raw data, coding guidelines and questionnaires can now be directly downloaded from this site.
Please see also SSD's Farm Household Survey Database (http://ricestat.irri.org/fhsd/).

fields.value: STRASA = Stress Tolerant Rice for poor farmers in Africa and South Asia (India, Orissa)

authorName.value: Gauchan, D., Malabayabas, M., Emerick, R. and Pandey, S.

dsDescriptionValue.value: 1. Analyze patterns of varietal adoption and the factors that influence the adoption of improved varieties.  2. Analyze the economics of rice production and returns to varietal change. 3. Asess farmers' livelihood strategies in stress-prone rainfed environments.  4. Understand the gender roles in rice production and women's participation in decision making.  5. Derive implications for technology design, targeting, and policy reforms for enhancing the impact of improved technologies in stress-prone areas.

fields.value: Subject: Number of Repondents  Type: Sample Size  Notes: 409;
